full_summary:
### Canadian Integrated Program for Antimicrobial Resistance Surveillance (CIPARS) Feedlot Cattle Respiratory and Enterococcus Pathogen Testing

#### Project Description

The Public Health Agency of Canada (PHAC), Food-borne Disease and AMR Surveillance Division (FDASD), seeks the services of an accredited microbiological laboratory for the CIPARS Feedlot surveillance initiative. 

The contractor shall perform services related to the primary isolation, identification, and susceptibility testing of Enterococcus spp. and the bovine respiratory disease (BRD) pathogens, specifically Histophilus somni, Pasteurella multocida, and Mannheimia haemolytica. Sensititre susceptibility testing is a mandatory requirement. 

The services will be provided on a national level, and the contractor is expected to report on an annual basis, listing all samples received and whether they were positive for the organisms of interest, as well as the susceptibility results by antimicrobial. All reporting shall be submitted to Health Canada by February 1st of each year. 

#### Contract Details

*   The contract duration will be from [Starting Date] to March 31, 2025, with the option for two additional one-year periods. 
*   The expected contract value is confidential at this time and shall be communicated by the contracting party as necessary.
*   All invoicing shall be submitted to Health Canada by March 31st of each year.

#### Evaluation Criteria

The contract award shall be based on the contractor's ability to meet the requirements outlined in the Request for Proposal (RFP) and the client's evaluation criteria. 

*   Compliance with the RFP requirements and proposal instructions;
*   Capacity and expertise in the services to be provided;
*   Ability to achieve the expected outcomes; and
*   Financial and managerial abilities of the contractor. 

#### Opportunities

The successful contractor will have the opportunity to work with the Public Health Agency of Canada, a leading institution in the field of antimicrobial resistance surveillance, on a high-profile project contributing to the detection and prevention of antimicrobial-resistant bacteria in feedlot cattle.

#### Key Dates

*   The RFP closing date is January 24, 2023, at 2:00 PM EST.
*   The evaluation of proposals and award of the contract shall be completed by March 2023.
*   The contract is expected to commence in March 2023.
